noun.description: An earthenware pot containing combustibles or explosives, used as a missile. Now historical.
A small vessel in which something can be burnt or heated with fire, as a crucible or alembic.
A pot or pot-shaped receptacle in which fuel is burnt, specifically one in a stove or furnace.

Cookery. In East Asian cookery: a metal cooking pot consisting of a bowl surrounding a central chimney beneath which a source of heat is placed, used for cooking or warming broth-based dishes at the table; a dish cooked or served in such a pot. Frequently in "Mongolian firepot".

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in Inventory of Henry VIII. From fire + pot.
